linefit

Class ColorBoxRenderer

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JLabel
            • linefit.ColorBoxRenderer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.ListCellRenderer<java.lang.Object>, javax.swing.SwingConstants

    class ColorBoxRenderer
extends javax.swing.JLabel
implements javax.swing.ListCellRenderer<java.lang.Object>
    This class renders the square of color instead of a string in the drop down menu for selecting the line's color and renders a custom color option that users can select if none of the defined colors are suitable or more color options are needed
    Since:
    <0.98.0
    Version:
    2.0
    Author:
    Keith Rice

      • RESERVED_FOR_CUSTOM_COLOR

        public static final java.awt.Color RESERVED_FOR_CUSTOM_COLOR
        Defines the color we are using as reserved for the custom color option. Note that this just prevents the color from appearing in the drop down and does not actually prevent the color from being selected

      • customColor

        private java.awt.Color customColor
        The custom color to render the "custom" text with
